title: As a BOC user I want to add a form to the System Forms widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with System Forms widget edit permissions
WHEN user navigated to the System Forms widget
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Create New" button on the System Forms widget
custom_expected:
THEN user clicking this button allows the user to select "Form" 
AND If they click "Form" then a new row is added to the widget in edit mode.
AND There should be a "Save" button and a "Cancel All Changes" button in the widget footer.
AND The user should be able to populate the widget, per the data discovery, including uploading a new form. 
AND Clicking the red x on the row should cancel the addition of the form, and the entire row should be discarded. 
AND Clicking "Save" should run a required field check on the newly added form and, assuming the required field check passes, store the uploaded form with the entered information. 
AND Once the form has been saved, the form should be available for download from the widget by clicking on the paperclip icon.

Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=forms

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+System+Forms+widget

title: As a BOC user I want to add a new Country/Region to the system forms widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in with system forms widget edit permission
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Create New" button on the System Forms widget
custom_expected:
THEN system will allows the user to select "Country/Region" 
AND If they click "Country/Region" the system opens up a pop-up, per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The user has the ability to indicate if they are adding a new single country, or a new region composed of multiple countries.
AND If they select Single, then the provided dropdown only allows them to select a single country. 
BUT If they select Multiple Countries/Parts of a Country, then a "Label" text field is available in addition to a multi-select dropdown where they can pick a number of countries. 
AND If "Single Country" is selected, they should only be allowed to select countries that are not already available as a single country in the System Forms widget. (The full list available should be composed of the same list of countries we use everywhere in the system)
BUT If "Multiple Countries" is selected, they should be able to select any country - but should not be able to select any single country more than once for the SAME Region (in other words, Dominican Republic can be in 3 different regions - but can only appear once in each). 
AND Once the required values have been entered, the "Save" button becomes enabled. 
AND The "Cancel" button is always enabled. 
AND Clicking Cancel will close the modal and no new country or region is stored.
AND Clicking Save will store the new Country/Region.
AND The new Country/Region will be available for use when creating new and editing existing system forms.
AND When viewing the system forms widget, if a "Region" is selected for a form, in view mode there should be an information i icon that allows the user to view the full list of countries associated with that Region.

Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=new_country_region

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89350246

title: As a BOC user I want the Level 2 Possibles widget to be prepopulated
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Possible+L2+Widget+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with permission view the Level 2 Possibles widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to L2 Possibilities Widget
custom_expected:
THEN the L2 Possibilities widget should be automatically prepopulated with any player that has an International Workout report approved for them that identifies them as a Group 1, Group 2 or Group 3 player
AND this also means that approving an International Workout report that identifies the player as a Group 1, 2 or 3 player should auto-check the L2 Possibility checkbox on the player's profile
AND the delivery of this story should also include the removal of the "Report" column from the widget
AND if a player is manually removed from the widget, they should not reappear just because they have the report on file - but approving a NEW report for them should cause them to reappear
AND players added to the widget that have a scouting report on file should have the OFP and Group columns populated appropriately, even if they were not automatically added to the widget, and regardless of the OFP/Group identification
AND if the player has more than one, system should use the latest Approved

title: As a BOC user I want to see Unregistered players in the Registration Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC reg admin user is logged in with permission to view the Reg Admin Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Reg Admin Widget
custom_expected:
THEN Unregistered International Prospects should only appear in the Registration Admin widget if they are Approved
AND International Suspects should now appear in the widget under the "Unregistered" filter, or if the filter is set to "All"

title: As a user I want to be able to run the International Consolidated Search Report
custom_preconds:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Intl+Consolidated+Search+-+Report+Layout
Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Intl+Consolidated+Search+-+Report+Details
Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347957
Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Intl+Consolidated+Search+-+Report+Prompts
Report Security: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Intl+Consolidated+Search+-+Security+-+Frequency
GIVEN "International Consolidated Search" is a report in the Report listing widget
custom_steps: WHEN user selects this report from the widget
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch the prompts according to the requirements
AND the category of this report should be "International"
AND entering the desired prompts and running the report should work and match the requirements
AND the report should continue to use the existing LDAP

title: As a user I want running the All Registered Players List Report to download a pdf
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user logs with permission to print reports
AND the user is in Reporting widget
custom_steps: WHEN user selects the report from the widget
custom_expected:
THEN system will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
AND Entering the desired prompts and running the report will download a pdf of the selected report to the user's computer.

title: As a BOC user I want Create New International Amateur player attempts tracked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Edit International Amateur permissions
AND user is creating new Intl amateur player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Next" or "Register" from the New Player form for international amateurs
custom_expected:
THEN the system will keep a record of every time a user hits "Next" or "Register" from the New Player form for international amateurs. 
AND the system will keep a record of the following information about each attempt: 
 - Username of the user conducting the search
 - Org of the user conducting the search
 - Date of the search
 - Time of the search (EST)
 - The value entered for First Name
 - The value entered for Last Name
 - The value entered for National ID
 - The value entered for Home Country
 - The value entered for Birth Country
 - The value entered for DOB
 - The value entered for Birth District/Province
 - The value entered for Birth City
 - The value entered for Birth Sector
 - The value entered for Twin Count
 - How many results were returned
AND Each time the user hits "Next", "Register" or "Check Registration" is considered a new and unique search. 
AND Spreadsheet upload is also considered a Check Registration workflow and should be tracked accordingly.

title: As a BOC user I want the actions taken after an International Amateur Create New attempt tracked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Create New International Profile permissions
AND user navigated to the International Amateur Create New Tab
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to Create New International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will need to keep a record of the following information about the actions taken for each search: 
 - Profiles opened as a result of the search. (Last, First and Player ID)
 - Whether the user "tagged" the player as a result of the search.
 - Whether the user created a Contract as a result of the search. 
 - Whether the user registered the player as a result of the search.

title: As a BOC user I want the actions taken after an International Amateur advanced search tracked
custom_preconds: GIVEN logic is in place to track International Advanced Search attempts and Actions taken after International Advance Search
custom_steps: WHEN a user Advanced Searches for an International player
custom_expected:
THEN system should keep a record of the following information about the actions taken for each search: 
 - Profiles opened as a result of the search. (Last, First and Player ID)
 - Whether the user "tagged" the player as a result of the search.
 - Whether the user created a Contract as a result of the search. 
 - Whether the user registered the player as a result of the search.
AND this tracked data can be verified via the International Consolidated Search Report

title: As a scouting user I want to create an Unregistered player profile
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_amateur
GIVEN a new LDAP has been created that allows users to see the Create New tab on the Scouting Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN a scouting user that has this LDAP logs in
custom_expected:
THEN user should see Scouting as an option on the Left Nav
AND the user should be able to see a "Create New" tab on the "Scouting" dashboard
AND loading the Create New tab on the Scouting Dashboard should load the create new international player form per the provided wireframe (Option should read "Unregistered International Amateur")
AND there should only be one option available right now  
AND the "Next" button should enable once all required fields have been entered
AND clicking "Next" with a date of birth entered that indicates that the player is subject to registration (after-09/01/1995) should load a new International Amateur profile per the provided wireframe and data discovery. (Use the MLSB column for required fields and fields to display)
AND the Scouting Status for these players should default to International Prospect
AND users should only be able to manually change this to International Suspect
AND LDAP should be added to test_ebis_user73@mlb.com through test_ebis_user76@mlb.com users created in #156057810 (77 and 78 purposely left off)

*For now - ONLY test by entering players who are genuinely subject to registration -  We are going to trigger an error for grandfathered players but that is covered in another test case

title: As a scouting user I want to save an Unregistered International Amateur profile as Preliminary
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in with Permission to create/edit Unregistered International Amateur profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user is creating a new Unregistered International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a "Save" button as well as a "Cancel" button. 
AND Clicking Cancel will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, then the creation process should be canceled, the profile should be discarded and the user should be returned to their point of entry.
AND Clicking "Save" will save the profile as "Preliminary".
AND No required field or formatting checks are run when saving a profile in preliminary
AND Preliminary scouting profiles should appear on the Scout's Clipboard

*NOTE: The stateflow for international amateurs is different depending on the Scouting Status. This test case refers to the creation of International Prospects, so the Scouting Status MUST be set to that for this flow.*

title: As a scouting user I want to Submit a new International Amateur profile for review(International Prospects)
custom_preconds:
**NOTE: The stateflow for international amateurs is different depending on the Scouting Status. This test case refers to the creation of International Prospects, so the Scouting Status MUST be set to that for this flow.**
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to Submit new International Amateur profiles
custom_steps: WHEN scouting user opens a preliminary player profile in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN user should have an Edit, Submit and Close button
AND clicking Close should close the profile
BUT when the profile is in Edit Mode, user should have a Save, Submit and Cancel button
AND clicking "Save" should save any edits made to the profile
AND no required field and formatting checks should be run given that the profile is in a Preliminary state
AND the profile's status should not update
AND clicking "Cancel" should ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any changes
AND if the user confirms, the profile's status should remain preliminary and the profile should reload in view mode
AND clicking "Submit" should run a required field and formatting check per the data discovery
AND once the profile has passed the required field and formatting checks, if the profile was in edit mode, it should be reloaded in view mode
AND the player's status should update to "Submitted"
AND the status should be reflected on the creating scout's Clipboard
AND the player profile should appear for review on the scouting Admin's Clipboard

title: As a scouting admin I want to Approve a new Unregistered player profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a new permission has been created to control the approval of Unregistered International Amateur profiles
custom_steps: WHEN a user with approval permissions is viewing an Unregistered International Amateur profile that is in a Preliminary, Submitted or Rejected status
custom_expected:
THEN an Approve button should be available in edit or view mode
AND clicking "Approve" should save any edits made to the profile
AND all required field and formatting checks should be run at this point 
AND once the field checks pass, the profile's status should be updated to "Approved"
AND if the form was in edit mode, it should reload in view mode
AND the player profile should appear as an Unregistered player in the Registration Admin widget

**NOTE:New User set up to test this with: Org of BOC, Pro Player Viewer role, as well as the new intl-user LDAP and the new LDAP mentioned in the first AC, should be posted in the comments on attached story**

title: As a scouting user I want to create an International Suspect profile for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in with Permission to create an International Suspect profile for a player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Create New tab
custom_expected:
THEN system will load the create new international player form
AND The "Next" button will enable once all required fields have been entered.
AND Clicking "Next" will load the appropriate profile based on whether or not the player is subject to registration.
AND The Scouting Status will default to International Prospect. Users will only be able to manually change this to International Suspect. 
AND Changing the Scouting Status to "International Suspect" will remove the "Submit" button from the profile form. 
AND The required field markers should also update to only show the fields required to create an International Suspect.
AND Switching back to "International Prospect" should re-display the Submit button and adjust the required field markers. 
AND When "International Suspect" is set as the Scouting Status, clicking "Save" will run a required field and format check per the data discovery. 
AND Fields required for saving a profile as a Suspect are indicating in the data discovery by the note "req'd for suspect". 
AND On successful save, the system will display a successful save notification and reload the profile in View mode. 

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_amateur

title: As a scouting user I want to convert an International Suspect profile to an International Prospect
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user loads an existing "International Suspect" profile
custom_expected:
THEN Scouts will see an "Edit" and "Close" button. 
AND In edit, the scout will be able to update the scouting status to "International Prospect", which should display the Submit button and adjust the required field markers. There should not be a "Save" button. 
AND Clicking "Submit" should run a required field and format check, just as though the scout were creating and submitting a new international amateur profile. 
AND The player should appear as a Submitted New Player on the Scout Clipboard, and the Admin Clipboard.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_amateur

title: As a scouting user I want to see a warning if I am attempting to enter a new unregistered player profile that matches another profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in with permission to create unregistered player profile
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to create unregistered player profile that matches another profile
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Next" on the Create New when creating a new Unregistered player profile will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to another international player profile that the user has permission to see as a match, then the user gets an error. See Messages #7. 
AND The same visibility rules should also apply to the "Add Player" check on Daily Reports.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if I attempt to create a Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scout is logged in with permission to create unregistered profiles
custom_steps: WHEN user loads the Create New tab on the Scouting Dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN system should load the create new international player form per the provided wireframe (Option should read "Unregistered International Amateur")
AND the "Next" button should enable once all required fields have been entered
AND clicking "Next" with a date of birth entered that indicates that the player is NOT subject to registration (pre-9/1/95), should result in an error (Messages # 50):
"You may not create an Unregistered profile for a player who is not subject to registration. Please use the New Player form on the International dashboard to create a grandfathered profile." 
AND only "Back" button should be available
AND clicking "Back" should return user to point of entry

title: As a scouting user I want to delete a preliminary International Amateur profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scouting user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Preliminary International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a Delete button in view or edit mode
AND clicking "Delete" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the profile
AND confirming the delete should assign the profile a deleted status and throw a blue notification "Successfully deleted"
AND this action can also be done via the Clipboard

title: As a Club user I no longer want to see the MLSB Group 1 or Group 2 field or Scouting Status field on international amateur profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with permission to view international amateur profiles
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an international amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN the "Group 1 or Group 2" field on the international amateur player profile should no longer be visible to non-BOC users
AND the Scouting Status field on the international amateur player profile should no longer be visible to non-BOC users

title: As a Scout I want to view an existing International Amateur Player profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scout user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to view an existing Intl Amateur Player profile
custom_expected:
THEN opening an existing Unregistered profile should display per the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND opening an existing Registration profile should display per the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND these users should not see BOC or Club entered Contact Information
BUT these users should see "Scout" entered Contact Information
AND opening an existing Grandfathered profile should display the same as if the user were a Club or regular BOC user
AND if the user IS NOT identified as a Scout, then the international player profiles should load as they always have for a regular registration user

title: As a user I want to view an existing International Signable Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in with International Signable Report permission
AND an international ama player has existing International Signable Report
custom_steps: WHEN user is in international player's Scouting History widget
custom_expected:
THEN the Report Type should be clickable hyperlink on the player's Scouting History widget. 
AND Clicking the hyperlink for International Signable reports opens the report in the same window.
AND The report follows the provided wireframe and data discovery.  
AND The browser tab text says "Signable Report(or if a code exists for this use that instead) - Last, First"
AND There is a Close button on the Report in view mode. Clicking close will return the user to their point of entry.

*Note that there are 2 different sets of fields/layouts depending on the position used for the report. If the player report is for a pitching position, use the pitching fields provided - otherwise use the position player fields*
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=prospect_report

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Prospect+or+Signable+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a scouting user I want to create a new Daily Report
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_1
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to create Daily Reports
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the International "Create New" screen
custom_expected:
THEN the "Type" dropdown should contain "Daily Report"
AND selecting "Daily Report" should display per the provided wireframe
AND clicking "Next" should take the user to a new Daily report, per the provided data discovery and wireframe
AND the "Add Player" button should enable if all of the required fields are populated
AND clicking "Add Player" should add a new player block to the top of the Report per the provided wireframe
AND the user should be able to populate the block accordingly

title: As a scouting user I want to Submit a new Daily Report for review
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to submit a new Daily Report
custom_steps: WHEN scouting user opens a preliminary daily report in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN user should have an Edit, Submit and Close button
AND clicking Close should close the report
AND when the report is in Edit Mode, they should have a Save, Submit and Cancel button
AND clicking "Save" should save any edits made to the report
AND no required field and formatting checks should be run given that the report is in a Preliminary state
AND the report's status should not update
AND clicking "Cancel" should ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any changes
AND if the user confirms, the report's status should remain preliminary and the report should reload in view mode
AND clicking "Submit" should run a required field and formatting check per the data discovery
AND once the report has passed the required field and formatting checks, if the report was in edit mode, it should be reloaded in view mode
AND the report's status should update to "Submitted", and the status should be reflected on the creating scout's Clipboard
AND the report should appear for review on the scouting Admin's Clipboard

title: As a scouting user I want to approve a new Daily Report
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_-_responsive_layout
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to approve Daily Reports
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a Daily Report that is in a Preliminary status in Edit Mode
custom_expected:
THEN Save, Approve, and Cancel buttons should be available
AND clicking "Cancel" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes
AND if they confirm, the report should be reloaded in view mode and no changes should be saved
AND clicking "Save" should save any edits made to the report
AND no required field and formatting checks should be run given that the report is in a Preliminary state
AND the report's status should not update
AND clicking "Approve" should save any edits made to the report
AND at this point all required field and formatting checks should be run
AND once the field checks pass, the form should be reloaded in View Mode, and the report's status should be updated to "Approved"
AND the report should appear in the Scouting History widget of any existing player that is contained in the report

*A submitted state MAY be added in the future, but for now we can assume that anyone who can create/edit an International Daily Report can Approve them.*

title: As a scout admin I want to reject a new Daily Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a scout admin is logged with the permissions to reject a new Daily Report
AND a scout admin navigated to their Admin Clipboard 
AND a scout admin opens the submitted report from the Clipboard in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN a scout admin click "Reject" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will save any edits made to the report. No required field or format checks are run. 
AND A blue notification will be thrown "Successfully Rejected"
AND The report's status should be updated to "Rejected". 
AND The report entry should be removed from the Admin Clipboard.
AND The Scout's Clipboard entry should be updated to "Rejected".

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_-_responsive_layout

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a scout I want to see an error if attempting to submit a Daily Report without at least one player
custom_preconds:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scout is logged in with permission to submit daily reports
AND user has a new daily report open in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" on a Daily Report
custom_expected:
THEN system should verify that at least one player has been added to the report
AND if not system should display an error(Messages #49):
"You must include at least one player."
AND only a "Back" button should be available
AND clicking "Back" should take user back to point of entry
AND this check should also be run on approve

title: As a scouting user I want submitting a Daily Report to automatically create profiles for any players included in the report that do not yet exist in the system
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_1
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in
AND user is attempting to submit a Daily report with one or more players added that were manually added to the report (did not already have a profile in the system)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" on a Daily Report
custom_expected:
THEN system should automatically create an International Suspect profile for any player included in the report that was manually added to the report
AND the profile created should have a scouting status of International Suspect
AND the profile's information should be populated according to the information entered by the Scout on the Daily Report
AND the profile should be automatically Approved
AND this should ALSO be done on Approve in case any new profiles were added to a Submitted report
AND the International Suspect profile should show the Daily Report in their Scouting History

title: As a scout I want to see an error if attempting to submit a Daily Report for a future date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to Submit Daily Report
AND user opens a preliminary Daily Report in view or edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Submit" button
custom_expected:
THEN The system will verify that the Report Date is not in the future. If the date is in the future, display an error. See Messages #48. 
AND This check should also be run on approve.


Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: International Daily Report - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in that has any of the following permissions, AND the new intl-user LDAP: 
  - EBIS-INTL-DAILY-REPORT-EDITORS
  - EBIS-INTL-DAILY-REPORT-APPROVERS (This is a new LDAP and needs to be created)
  - EBIS-INTL-DAILY-REPORT-VIEWERS
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to run International Daily Reports
custom_expected:
THEN International Daily Reports should ONLY be visible to those users (that have permission to view the reports)
AND the following user IDs should be set up with the permissions listed: 
  - test_ebis_user73@mlb.com should have the editors permission (Scout)
  - test_ebis_user74@mlb.com should have the approvers permission (Scout Admin)
  - test_ebis_user77@mlb.com should have the viewers permission (Scout Viewer)
  - test_ebis_user75@mlb.com should have the approvers permission (BOC Admin and Scout Admin)
  - test_ebis_user76@mlb.com should have the editors permission (BOC Admin and Scout)
  - test_ebis_user78@mlb.com should have the viewers permission (BOC Viewer and Scout Viewer)

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the entered OFP is not between 20 and 80
custom_preconds:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in 
AND user has an intl workout report open in edit mode
AND user has entered an OFP Adjusted or OFP Basic value that is NOT between 20 and 80(inclusive)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should checks that the OFP Adjusted and Basic entered is a value between 40 and 80 (inclusive)
AND if not,  system should display an error, Messages #45:
"The following fields contain invalid data: 1. Field Name - Value must be between 20 and 80."
AND only Back button should be available
AND clicking back should return user to entry point

title: As a scouting user I want to create a new International Workout report for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN scouting user logs in with permission to create International Workout report
custom_steps: WHEN user is in "Create New" screen
custom_expected:
THEN the "Type" dropdown contains "International Workout Report".
AND Selecting "international Workout Report" displays per the provided wireframe.
AND The user should be able to use the player field to pick a player to create the report for.
AND The population of players available here should be all players that the user has permission to see in QuickSearch. 
AND Selecting a player should enable the "Next" button.
AND Clicking "Next" should take the user to a new International Workout report, per the provided data discovery and wireframe. 
AND Changing the Position on the report should appropriately update the report to display the appropriate fields.

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_workout_report
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=workout_report

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Workout+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a scouting user I want to save as preliminary an International Workout report for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN scouting user logs in with permission to create International Workout report
custom_steps: WHEN user is creating a new International workout report on create new screen
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Save" button as well as a "Cancel" button. 
AND Clicking Cancel will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, then the creation process is canceled, the profile discarded and the user returned to their point of entry.
AND Clicking "Save" will save the report as "Preliminary" and a blue successful save notification will be thrown.
AND No required field or formatting checks are run when saving a report in preliminary.

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_amateur
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=workout_report

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Workout+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a scout admin I want to approve a new International Workout report for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN scouting user logs in with permission to Approve International Workout report
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an International Workout Report that is in a Preliminary status in Edit Mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be Save, Approve, and Cancel buttons available.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the report is reloaded in view mode and no changes are saved.
AND Clicking "Save" will save any edits made to the report. No required field and formatting checks should be run given that the report is in a Preliminary state. The report's status will not update.
AND Clicking "Approve" will save any edits made to the report. All required field and formatting checks should be run. Once the field checks pass, the form should be reloaded in View Mode, and the report's status should be updated to "Approved" and a blue notification should be thrown.
AND The required field checks will differ based on the Position entered on the report (not necessarily the same as the player's position on their profile). 
AND The report should appear in the player's Scouting History widget. 

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_amateur
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=workout_report

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Workout+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a Scouting user I want to see an error if I am attempting to submit a player report without first submitting the player profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Submit" on a new International Workout report
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the associated player profile is not a Preliminary or Rejected profile. 
AND If the player profile has a status of Preliminary or Rejected, display an error. Messages # 33

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Scout Admin I want to see an error if I am attempting to approve a player report without first approving the associated player profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Approve" on a new International Workout report
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the associated player profile is an Approved profile. 
AND If the player profile has a status other than Approved, display an error. Messages # 34

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a scouting user I want the system to calculate a player's OFP and Group on an International Workout Report
custom_preconds:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Scouting+Calculations
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to create/edit International Workout Reports
AND user currently has an International Workout Report open in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user enters values into the Workout info fields in the Future(F) column
custom_expected:
THEN system should calculate the OFP Basic and the Group number displayed on the International Workout report on the fly (as the user enters grades) per the provided calculations(see business rules above)
AND the calculation is different depending on if the report is for a position player or a pitcher

title: As a scout admin I want to reject a new International Workout report for a player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a scouting Admins user is logged in with permission to reject new International Workout Reports
AND user opens a workout report in edit mode with a submitted status from the admin clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Reject" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will save any edits made to the report. No required field or format checks are run. 
AND  A blue notification will be thrown "Successfully Rejected"
AND The report's status should be updated to "Rejected". 
AND The report entry should be removed from the Admin Clipboard.
AND The Scout's Clipboard entry should be updated to "Rejected".

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_amateur
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=workout_report

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Workout+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I want to be able to search for International Player Reports
custom_preconds:
Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Search+-+International+Player+Report
GIVEN a user is logged in with permission to view International Player Reports
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to advanced search
custom_expected:
THEN "International Player Reports2" should be an option 
AND this advanced search should have the filters available per the above requirements document
AND the available columns should match the requirements document
AND Export to excel and pdf should work for the results set
AND by default, only Approved reports are shown in results UNLESS the user purposefully adds a status filter to the search to look for other statuses
NOTE:This functionality should not impact the existing "International Player Report"  advanced search - that will be 'turned off' at a later date

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the entered velocity does not fall within the allowable range
custom_preconds:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Workout+Report+-+Data+Discovery
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in 
AND user is attempting to submit an intl workout report for a player
AND user has entered a value in one or more of the velocity fields that does NOT fall within allowed ranges (per DD)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the values entered in the Velocity fields fall within the allowed ranges (see data discovery)
AND if not, system should display an error, Messages #44:
"Maximum velocity must be greater than or equal to minimum velocity."
AND only Back button should be available
AND clicking Back should return user to point of entry

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if maximum velocity entered is not equal to or greater than minimum velocity
custom_preconds:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in 
AND user is attempting to submit or approve an intl workout report 
AND user has entered values in the Maximum Velocity fields that are greater than or equal to the values entered in the minimum velocity fields
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the values entered in the Maximum Velocity fields are greater than or equal to the values entered in the Minimum velocity fields
AND if not, system should display an error, Messages #43:
"Maximum velocity must be greater than or equal to minimum velocity."
AND only Back button should be available
AND clicking Back should return user to the point of entry

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the value entered in any OFP category does not have a value of 0 or 2-8
custom_preconds:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in
AND user is attempting to submit an intl workout report 
AND user has entered a value in one or more of the OFP category fields that does not have a value of 0 or 2-8
custom_steps: WHEN a present or future grade field loses focus (user clicks out of the field or tabs out)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the value entered in the field is either 0, or a value between 2 and 8 (inclusive)
AND if not, system should display an error, See Messages #42:
"The following fields contain invalid data: 1. Field Name - Please enter a value of 0 or 2-8. "
AND only Back button should be available
AND clicking Back should return user to the point of entry

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the present value in any OFP category is not less than or equal to the Future value
custom_preconds:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in
AND user has entered a Present Value in any OFP category that is NOT less than or equal to the Future Value
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the values entered in the Future grade fields are greater than or equal to the values entered in the Present grade fields
AND if not, system should display an error, Messages #41:
"The Future OFP must be greater than or equal to the Present OFP" 
AND only Back button should be available
AND clicking Back should return user to the point of entry

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the OFP Adjusted entered is not within 3 points of the OFP Basic
custom_preconds:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in
AND user is attempting to submit or approve an intl workout report
AND user has entered a value in the OFP Adjusted field that is NOT within three points of calculated OFP Basic
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the value entered in the OFP Adjusted field is within three points of the calculated OFP Basic
AND if not, and no comments are entered in the OFP Adjusted comments field, then system should display an error, Messages #40:
"You must enter a comment if OFP Adjusted is not within 3 points of OFP Basic."
AND only Back button should be available 
AND clicking Back should return user to the point of entry
*Example: if the OFP Basic is 50, the user can enter 47-53 without needing to enter comments, but if they enter a value outside of that range they need to provide comments*

title: As a user I want approving an International Workout report to set the player's Scouting Status
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scout admin user is logged in with permission to approve Intl Workout Reports
custom_steps: WHEN user Approves an International Workout report
custom_expected:
THEN the player's Scouting Status should be set to International Prospect if it was not already set
AND once this status has been set, it should always appear under Scouting Info section for BOC and Scouting users
BUT it should no longer display at all for Club users

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Player Report
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_-_responsive_layout
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scout or scout admin user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to edit an existing player report
custom_expected:
THEN Scouts (editors) should only be able to edit International Workout Reports in the Preliminary and Rejected statuses
AND Scout Admins (approvers) should be able to edit Approved and Submitted International Workout reports
AND no one should be able to edit the historical International Prospect or International Workout reports

title: As a Scout I want to view an existing trainer/agent profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Scouting user logs in with View/Edit trainer/agent permission
custom_steps: WHEN navigates to trainer/agent widget
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to open trainer/agent profiles from trainer/agent widget
AND The profile appears for scouting users just like it does for BOC users.

title: As a Scouting user I want to save a new trainer/agent profile as preliminary
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in with scouting and trainer/agent edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the trainer/agent widget
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a Create New button there.
AND Clicking on the Create New button will launch a new trainer/agent profile form. 
AND The scout will have a "Save", "Submit" and "Cancel" button on the form, assuming that they are not also a Registration analyst/admin. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user that they wish to confirm. If they confirm, the new profile will be discarded and the user will be returned to the point of entry.
AND Clicking "Save" will save the profile as Preliminary. At least one name field is required to save the profile as preliminary. No other fields are required to save as preliminary.
AND The trainer/agent profile will reload in view mode, and the trainer/agent's status will be set to "Preliminary". 
AND The trainer/agent profile will appear on the Scout's Clipboard with a status of "Preliminary"

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347878

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=create_a_new_trainer_agent

title: As a Scouting user I want to submit a new trainer/agent profile for review
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in with scouting and trainer/agent edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a preliminary trainer/agent profile in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be Edit, Submit and Close button
AND Clicking Close will close the profile.
AND When the profile is in Edit Mode, they will have a Save, Submit and Cancel button. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any changes. If the user confirms, the profile's status will remain preliminary and the profile will reload in view mode.
AND Clicking "Submit" will run a required field and formatting check per the data discovery. 
AND Once the profile has passed the required field and formatting checks, if the profile was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode.
AND The trainer/agent's status will update to "Submitted", and the status will be reflected on the creating scout's Clipboard. 
AND The trainer/agent profile will appear for review on the Scouting Admin's Clipboard.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347878

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=create_a_new_trainer_agent

title: As a Scout Admin I want to Reject a new Trainer/Agent profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting admin logs in with scouting and trainer/agent edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing their Admin Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN Scouting Admins should see any trainer/agent profile with a Submitted status on their Admin Clipboard. 
AND Opening the submitted trainer/agent profile from the Clipboard should open the item in Edit Mode.
AND Clicking "Reject" will save any edits made to the profile. No required field or format checks are run. 
AND The profile's status should be updated to "Rejected". 
AND The trainer/agent entry should be removed from the Admin Clipboard.
AND The Scout's Clipboard entry should be updated to "Rejected".

title: As a Scout I want to resubmit a new trainer/agent profile for review
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scout logs in
custom_steps: WHEN they are viewing their Scout Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN Scouts see any trainer/agent profiles created by them on their Scout Clipboard when they are in a Rejected status.
AND Opening a Rejected trainer/agent profile from the Clipboard opens the profile in edit mode with a "Save" "Cancel" and "Submit" button available.
AND The scout should be able to edit the profile and save changes without a required field or formatting check.
AND Clicking "Submit" from a rejected profile should save any edits made, run a required field and format check and complete the submission, just as though the profile were in a Preliminary status. 
AND The profile should have its status updated to Submitted, and appear on the Admin Clipboard and Scout Clipboard as Submitted.

title: As a Scouting user I want to delete a trainer/agent profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouts and Scout Admins logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a trainer/agent profile in a Preliminary state
custom_expected:
THEN Scouts and Scout Admins see a "Delete" button 
AND Clicking the "Delete" button will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the item.
AND If they confirm, the item is assigned a "Deleted" status, and no longer appears on any Clipboard, or in any search unless the user has specifically searched for Deleted profiles. 
AND Scouts or Scout Admins that also have BOC permissions can delete profiles in any state.

title: As a scouting user I want to include a Preliminary or Submitted trainer/agent on a new International Player Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN scouting user logs in
AND the user has created a preliminary trainer/agents
custom_steps: WHEN the scouting user creates a new International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN the "trainer/agent" dropdown should include preliminary trainer/agents that the scout has created. They should not see preliminary trainer/agents created by other Scouts. 
AND When a scouting user is creating a new International Amateur profile, the "trainer/agent" dropdown should include submitted trainer/agents that the scout has created. They should not see submitted trainer/agents created by other Scouts. 
AND BOC users should continue to not see ANY Preliminary or Submitted trainer/agent profiles when creating or editing Registration profiles. (they can view the information on the submitted player profiles if they pull them up)

title: As a Scouting user I want to see an error if I am attempting to submit a player profile without first submitting the trainer/agent
custom_preconds: GIVEN scouting user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" on a new International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the trainer/agent selected in the profile is not a Preliminary or Rejected profile. 
AND If the trainer/agent has a status of Preliminary or Rejected status, display an error. Messages # 31

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Scout Admin I want to see an error if I am attempting to approve a player profile without first approving the trainer/agent
custom_preconds: GIVEN scouting user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Approve" on a new International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the trainer/agent selected in the profile is Approved. 
AND If the trainer/agent has a status other than "Approved", display an error. Messages # 32

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to edit an existing trainer/agent profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC, Club and Scouts user logs with trainer/agent editors or approvers permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing trainer/agent profile
custom_expected:
THEN all users with the trainer/agent editors or approvers permissions are able to edit Approved trainer/agent profiles.
AND Users with the trainer/agent editors permission are able to create new trainer/agent profiles.
AND If  the user is identified as being a Scout, then they must submit the profile for approval. 
AND If the user is not identified as being a Scout, then they can only save the profile as Approved. 
AND Users with the trainer/agent editors permission that are NOT scouts are able to view preliminary and submitted trainer/agent profiles and edit them. Clicking "Save" on these profiles will automatically approve the profile. 
AND Users with the trainer/agent editors permission that ARE scouts are not able to edit Submitted trainer/agent profiles. 
AND Users with the trainer/agent editors permission that ARE scouts are not able to edit Preliminary or Rejected trainer/agent profiles that they are not the creating scout for. (They also shouldn't really be able to see these).
AND No one should be able to edit a deleted profile.

title: As a user I want to see an error if I enter in an invalid email address
custom_preconds:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a user is logged in with permission to edit Trainer/Agent profiles
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Save" on a trainer/agent profile
custom_expected:
THEN system should verify that an email address entered in the profile is in a proper email address format
AND if not, system should display Messages #51:
"You have entered an invalid email address."
AND only Back button should be available
AND clicking Back should return user to the point of entry
*Note that this does not guarantee that this is a valid email address that will work - just that it is formatted like an email*

title: As a scouting user I want to be able to create a new Trainer/Agent while editing a Workout Report
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=workout_report
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to edit intl Workout Reports
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an intl Workout Report open in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be an "Add New Trainer" hyperlink (See wireframe for placement)
AND clicking "Add New Trainer" should open a new trainer/agent form in a new tab/window for the user to complete the profile
AND the buttons available should depend on if the user is a scout or not
AND clicking "Save" or "Submit" on the new trainer/agent form should store the trainer/agent profile appropriately, just as though it were created through the normal "Create New" workflow
AND after the new trainer/agent has been saved - it should be prepopulated in the "Agents involved in workout" field of the Workout Report
AND this should not remove any trainer/agent names that have already been selected
